The wealth of the billionaire class is almost incomprehensible.

The Waltons get $70,000 richer every minute.

Jeff Bezos makes $2,489 a second.

That is why it is not radical to say that millions of people in this country should not be paid starvation wages.

Former WH Counsel Don McGahn must comply with this court order by testifying before Congress immediately.

And let's be clear: he shouldn't delay testifying by asking Gorsuch and Kavanaugh—the very justices he hand-picked for SCOTUS—to bail him out.

No one is above the law. https://twitter.com/ReutersPolitics/status/1199099533441077248 QT @ReutersPolitics Judge rules Trump's former White House counsel Don McGahn must comply with congressional committee's subpoena for impeachment testimony http://pbs.twimg.com/tweet_video_thumb/EKQOpYeW4AAuOpN.jpg https://video.twimg.com/tweet_video/EKQOpYeW4AAuOpN.mp4

There's an epidemic of violence against Native American women in our country and we’re not doing nearly enough to stop it. One thing Congress can do: pass the Violence Against Women Reauthorization Act. Proud to cosponsor this bill—the Senate must pass it immediately.

RT @LittleLobbyists The President campaigned in 2016 on a promise to lower drug prices by negotiating Medicare prices; now he is backing off that promise, failing to support a plan that does exactly what he said he would do, & has yet to propose a drug price plan of his own 👀

#LowerDrugCosts https://twitter.com/TeamPelosi/status/1198990805979029504 QT @TeamPelosi Americans are paying astronomical prices for their prescription drugs. 

Why do Trump and Republicans in Washington side with big drug companies who rip off Americans and continue opposing giving Medicare the power to negotiate for #LowerDrugCosts?

When it comes to our health care plans, some candidates would eliminate Americans' choice, while others—by their own admission—leave 10 million uninsured. That's 10x the size of Delaware, and 100x the size of South Bend.

My plan does neither.

Learn more: https://kamalaharris.org/healthcare
I've proposed the biggest and most progressive increase in Social Security benefits in nearly half a century—an immediate $200 monthly increase. Families need financial security.

My experiences growing up in a working class family shaped my values as a candidate for president.

All of us have a story to tell of how we came to be a part of our fight for justice.

Let’s be honest and acknowledge that we are seeing a rapid movement toward a political system in which a handful of very wealthy people and special interests determine who gets elected or who does not.
 
That is not, to say the least, what this country is supposed to be about.

In 2020, we need:

→A plan to cover everyone
→A plan to bring down costs for Americans
→A plan to preserve choice

My Medicare for All plan achieves that.
